org.kite.wire

Class Wire

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kite.wire.Wire

  • public class Wire
extends java.lang.Object
    Main class for providing connection to local services.
    It connects WiredService exposed dependencies, annotated with Provided to client's Wired properties.
    See Also:
    Provided, Wired, WiredService

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Wire.ConnectionPair
      Key object to identify connections with service and target.

    • Method Detail

      • with

        public static Wire with(Context context)
        Constructs a new Wire instance upon given android.content.Context.
        Parameters:
        context -
        Returns:
        a newly created Wire instance upon given android.content.Context.

      • from

        public Wire from(java.lang.Class<? extends WiredService> service)
        Sets the service to connect to. This is same as call #from(android.content.Intent) with intent preset with service class.
        Parameters:
        service - to connect to
        Returns:
        this Wire instance

      • from

        public Wire from(Intent serviceIntent)
        Sets the service to connect to. Note, if nothing corresponds to given intent config, nothing will happen, and no fields will be injected in target.
        If you want to use direct connection, use from(Class)
        Parameters:
        serviceIntent - intent for binding to a service
        Returns:
        this Wire instance

      • to

        public Wire to(java.lang.Object object)
        Sets the target, that will be connected to service.
        Parameters:
        object - target, must not be null.
        Returns:
        this Wire instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if object is null

      • noInjection

        public Wire noInjection()
        Sets to not perform injection, when service is connected. You can specify callback, by calling setCallback(WireCallback), and it will be the same as using android.content.ServiceConnection
        Returns:
        this Wire instance

      • setCallback

        public void setCallback(WireCallback callback)
        Sets the callback, to notify when service is connected and disconnected. Whether perform injection or not, callback will be notified when service is connected and disconnected.
        Parameters:
        callback -

      • getServiceFacade

        public ServiceFacade getServiceFacade()
        Returns ServiceFacade associated with service, which is connected. Note, that it's only valid when service has successfully been connected. You can call this method if you want to avoid injection, but also want to use advantage of WiredService and Provided annotations.
        Returns:
        ServiceFacade associated with service, which is connected.
        See Also:
        noInjection()

      • connect

        public void connect()
        Connects to a service. This is same as android.content.Context#bindService(android.content.Intent, android.content.ServiceConnection, int) (and it's actually is using it ).

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects from current service connection.
